00001 #ifndef _LIGHTING_H_
00002 #define _LIGHTING_H_
00003 
00004 #include "Soldier Control.h"
00005 
00006 /****************************************************************************************
00007 * JA2 Lighting Module
00008 *
00009 *           Tile-based, ray-casted lighting system.
00010 *
00011 *           Lights are precalculated into linked lists containing offsets from 0,0, and a light
00012 * level to add at that tile. Lists are constructed by casting a ray from the origin of
00013 * the light, and each tile stopped at is stored as a node in the list. To draw the light
00014 * during runtime, you traverse the list, checking at each tile that it isn't of the type
00015 * that can obscure light. If it is, you keep traversing the list until you hit a node
00016 * with a marker LIGHT_NEW_RAY, which means you're back at the origin, and have skipped
00017 * the remainder of the last ray.
00018 *
00019 * Written by Derek Beland, April 14, 1997
00020 *
00021 ***************************************************************************************/
00022 
00023 #define           DISTANCE_SCALE                4
00024 #define           LIGHT_DUSK_CUTOFF       8
00025 #define           LIGHT_DECAY                         0.9   // shade level decay per tile distance
00026 
00027 // lightlist node flags
00028 #define           LIGHT_NODE_DRAWN        0x00000001        // light node duplicate marker
00029 #define   LIGHT_ROOF_ONLY                 0x00001000        // light only rooftops
00030 #define           LIGHT_IGNORE_WALLS      0x00002000        // doesn't take walls into account
00031 #define           LIGHT_BACKLIGHT               0x00004000        // light does not light objs, trees
00032 #define           LIGHT_NEW_RAY                       0x00008000        // start of new ray in linked list
00033 #define           LIGHT_EVERYTHING        0x00010000        // light up everything
00034 #define           LIGHT_FAKE                          0x10000000        // "fake" light   for display only
00035

00039 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R2                       "LTO2.LHT"
00040 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R3                       "LTO3.LHT"
00041 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R4                       "LTO4.LHT"
00042 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R5                       "LTO5.LHT"
00043 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R6                       "LTO6.LHT"
00044 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R7                       "LTO7.LHT"
00045 #define           LIGHT_OMNI_R8                       "LTO8.LHT"

00054 #define           LIGHT_SPR_ACTIVE        0x0001
00055 #define           LIGHT_SPR_ON                        0x0002
00056 #define           LIGHT_SPR_ANIMATE       0x0004
00057 #define           LIGHT_SPR_ERASE               0x0008
00058 #define           LIGHT_SPR_REDRAW        0x0010
00059 #define           LIGHT_SPR_ONROOF        0x0020
00060 #define   MERC_LIGHT                0x0040
00061 #define           LIGHT_PRIMETIME               0x0080            // light turns goes on in evening, turns off at bedtime.
00062 #define           LIGHT_NIGHTTIME               0x0100            // light stays on when dark outside

00081 // stucture of node in linked list for lights
00082 typedef struct light_p {
00083                               INT16       iDX, iDY;
00084                               UINT8       uiFlags;
00085                               UINT8       ubLight;
00086                   } LIGHT_NODE;
00087 
00088 // structure of light instance, or sprite (a copy of the template)
00089 typedef struct {
00090                               INT16       iX, iY;
00091                               INT16       iOldX, iOldY;
00092                               INT16       iAnimSpeed;
00093                               INT32       iTemplate;
00094                               UINT32      uiFlags;
00095                               UINT32      uiLightType;
00096                   } LIGHT_SPRITE;

00099 // Initializes the lighting system
00100 BOOLEAN           InitLightingSystem(void);
00101 // Shuts down, and frees up all lights/memory
00102 BOOLEAN           ShutdownLightingSystem(void);
00103 // Resets all light sprites and deallocates templates
00104 BOOLEAN           LightReset(void);

00106 // THIS MUST BE CALLED ONCE ALL SURFACE VIDEO OBJECTS HAVE BEEN LOADED!
00107 BOOLEAN SetDefaultWorldLightingColors(void);

00109 // Low-Level Template Interface
00110 
00111 // Sets the normal light level for all tiles in the world
00112 BOOLEAN           LightSetBaseLevel(UINT8 iIntensity);
00113 // Adds a light value to all tiles
00114 BOOLEAN           LightAddBaseLevel(UINT32 uiLightType, UINT8 iIntensity);
00115 // Subtracts a light value from all tiles
00116 BOOLEAN           LightSubtractBaseLevel(UINT32 uiLightType, UINT8 iIntensity);
00117 // Creates an omni (circular) light
00118 INT32             LightCreateOmni( UINT8 ubIntensity, INT16 iRadius);
00119 // Creates an oval-shaped light (two separate radii)
00120 INT32             LightCreateElliptical(UINT8 ubIntensity, INT16 iRadius1, INT16 iRadius2);
00121 // Creates a square light
00122 INT32             LightCreateSquare(UINT8 ubIntensity, INT16 iRadius1, INT16 iRadius2);
00123 // Draws a light into the scene at X,Y
00124 BOOLEAN           LightDraw(UINT32 uiLightType, INT32 iLight, INT16 iX, INT16 iY, UINT32 uiSprite);
00125 // Reverts the tiles a light has affected back to normal
00126 BOOLEAN           LightErase(UINT32 uiLightType, INT32 iLight, INT16 iX, INT16 iY, UINT32 uiSprite);
00127 // Save a light list into a file
00128 BOOLEAN           LightSave(INT32 uiLight, STR pFilename);
00129 // Load a light list from a file
00130 INT32             LightLoad(STR pFilename);
00131 
00132 // Sets the RGB values and number of light colors (1/2)
00133 BOOLEAN LightSetColors(SGPPaletteEntry *pPal, UINT8 ubNumColors);
00134 // Returns the number of colors active (1/2) and the palette colors
00135 UINT8 LightGetColors(SGPPaletteEntry *pPal);
